intro: Cyrtandra villosissima var. flavovirens, commonly known as the yellow-green cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically yellow or greenish-yellow in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after species in horticulture.
